text: Rhodesia at the Olympics is a history which began in 1928. The International Olympic Committee's official abbreviation for Rhodesia is RHO. "Official abbreviations" at The Games of the XVIII Olympiad, Tokyo, 1964, [p. 9 of 409 PDF]; retrieved 2012-10-12. ==History== A team from Rhodesia was first in the Olympic Games in 1928. They were also at the 1960 Summer Olympics and 1964 Summer Olympics. The country always competed as a British territory. It was unable to be in the 1968 Games in Mexico."1972: Rhodesia out of Olympics", BBC Following Ian Smith's declaration of an independent Rhodesian republic in 1970, they never competed again. In 1972, Rhodesia was expelled by the International Olympic Committee four days before the opening ceremony. This was due to pressure from other African countries, which did not recognise the legitimacy of the Rhodesian state."Rhodesia expelled", Montreal Gazette, August 23, 1972 The country's successor state, Zimbabwe, made its Olympic d√©but in 1980. Rhodesia was never in the Winter Olympics.
